instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay runs a ForLoop from 0 to 9 and prints the index each iteration.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ForLoopPrint
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CountToTen
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: PrintString

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute

DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String] {
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CountToTen
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: PrintString

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute

DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String] {

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay uses a ForLoop 0 to 4 to spawn 5 actors in a row, each 200 units apart on the X axis.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RowSpawner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=4]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=200.0]
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0, Z=0]
NODE n5: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Item]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.SpawnTransform [Transform]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnRow
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=4]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=200.0]
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n5: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Target]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.A [Int]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.SpawnTransform [Transform] {
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnRow
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=4]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=200.0]
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n5: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Target]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.A [Int]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.SpawnTransform [Transform] {

instruction: Create a Blueprint with integer Total at 0. On BeginPlay use ForLoop 1 to 10 to sum all numbers. After completion print the total.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SumLoop
PARENT: Actor
VAR Total: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=1, LastIndex=10]
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Total]
NODE n4: AddInt
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=Total]
NODE n6: VariableGet [VarName=Total]
NODE n7: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n2.Index -> n4.B [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Int]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SumForLoop
PARENT: Actor
VAR Total: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Total]
NODE n3: ForLoopFirst [FirstIndex=1, LastIndex=10]
NODE n4: AddInt
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=Total]
NODE n6: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n3.Index -> n4.B [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Int]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n6.InString [String] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SumForLoop
PARENT: Actor
VAR Total: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Total]
NODE n3: ForLoopFirst [FirstIndex=1, LastIndex=10]
NODE n4: AddInt
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=Total]
NODE n6: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n3.Index -> n4.B [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Int]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n6.InString [String] }

DATA n5.Value -> n6.A [Int]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Value [Int]
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n7.Value -> n8.InString [String]

instruction: Create a Blueprint that loops 0 to 19. For each index check if even using modulo. If even print the index.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_EvenPrinter
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=19]
NODE n3: Modulo [B=2]
NODE n4: EqualEqual [B=0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.A [Int]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n6.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_EvenLoop
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=Index]
NODE n3: WhileLoop
NODE n4: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n5: Modulo [B=2]
NODE n6: EqualEqual [B=true]
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: PrintString
NODE n9: GetVar [Variable=Index]
NODE n10: Concatenate [B=" is even"]
NODE n11: PrintString
NODE n12: GetVar [Variable=Index]
NODE n13: LessEqual [B=20]
NODE n14: NotEqual
NODE n15: Branch
NODE n16: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer", Time=1.0, Looping=false]
NODE n17: Event_CustomEvent [EventName="OnTimer"]
NODE n18: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer"]
NODE n19: RemoveFromParent
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
DATA n9.Value -> n10.A [String]
DATA n10.ReturnValue -> n11.InString [String]
EXEC n7.False -> n11.Execute
DATA n12.Value -> n13.A [Int]
DATA n13.ReturnValue -> n14.Input [Bool]
DATA n14.ReturnValue -> n15.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n15.True -> n16.Execute
EXEC n16.Then -> n17.Then
EXEC n17.Then -> n18.Execute
EXEC n18.Then -> n19.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.A [Int]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Bool]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
DATA n9.Value -> n8.InString [String]
DATA n12.Value -> n10.B [String]
DATA n13.ReturnValue -> n15.Condition [Bool] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_EvenLoop
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=Index]
NODE n3: WhileLoop
NODE n4: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n5: Modulo [B=2]
NODE n6: EqualEqual [B=true]
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: PrintString
NODE n9: GetVar [Variable=Index]
NODE n10: Concatenate [B=" is even"]
NODE n11: PrintString
NODE n12: GetVar [Variable=Index]
NODE n13: LessEqual [B=20]
NODE n14: NotEqual
NODE n15: Branch
NODE n16: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer", Time=1.0, Looping=false]
NODE n17: Event_CustomEvent [EventName="OnTimer"]
NODE n18: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer"]
NODE n19: RemoveFromParent
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
DATA n9.Value -> n10.A [String]
DATA n10.ReturnValue -> n11.InString [String]
EXEC n7.False -> n11.Execute
DATA n12.Value -> n13.A [Int]
DATA n13.ReturnValue -> n14.Input [Bool]
DATA n14.ReturnValue -> n15.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n15.True -> n16.Execute
EXEC n16.Then -> n17.Then
EXEC n17.Then -> n18.Execute
EXEC n18.Then -> n19.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.A [Int]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Bool]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
DATA n9.Value -> n8.InString [String]
DATA n12.Value -> n10.B [String]
DATA n13.ReturnValue -> n15.Condition [Bool] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Targets. On pressing Fire, ForEachLoop destroys all targets then prints All Destroyed.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DestroyAll
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: DestroyActor
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="All Destroyed"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.Target [Actor]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FireAll
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: DestroyActor
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="All Destroyed"]

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]

EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.Target [Actor]

EXEC n3.Completed -> n5.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FireAll
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: DestroyActor
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="All Destroyed"]

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]

EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.Target [Actor]

EXEC n3.Completed -> n5.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay uses two nested ForLoops 0 to 2 to spawn actors in a 3x3 grid with 100 unit spacing.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GridSpawner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=2]
NODE n3: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=2]
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n5: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n6: MakeVector [Z=0]
NODE n7: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Tile]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n7.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n3.Index -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.X [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Y [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.SpawnTransform [Transform]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GridSpawn
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=2]
NODE n3: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=2]
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n5: MakeVector [X=0.0, Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n6: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Spawn]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.FirstIndex [Int32]
DATA n2.Index -> n3.LastIndex [Int32]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n3.Index -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.X [Float]
DATA n3.Index -> n4.B [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Y [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.SpawnTransform [Transform] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GridSpawn
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=2]
NODE n3: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=2]
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n5: MakeVector [X=0.0, Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n6: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Spawn]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.FirstIndex [Int32]
DATA n2.Index -> n3.LastIndex [Int32]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n3.Index -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.X [Float]
DATA n3.Index -> n4.B [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Y [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.SpawnTransform [Transform] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay runs ForLoop 1 to 3 printing each index. After the loop waits 2 seconds then prints Done.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LoopThenWait
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=1, LastIndex=3]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CountToThree
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=1, LastIndex=3]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CountToThree
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=1, LastIndex=3]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array AllActors. On BeginPlay loop through all. For each check distance less than 500 and print name of nearby ones.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_NearbyFilter
PARENT: Actor
VAR AllActors: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=AllActors]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: GetDistanceTo
NODE n5: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n6: Branch
NODE n7: GetDisplayName
NODE n8: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n6.True -> n8.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n7.Target [Actor]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.InString [String]

NODE n7: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n6.True -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n7.InString [String] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with float Value at 1000. Use WhileLoop to keep halving Value while greater than 1. Print the final value.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HalveLoop
PARENT: Actor
VAR Value: Float = 1000.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: WhileLoop
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Value]
NODE n4: GreaterThan [B=1.0]
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=Value]
NODE n6: DivideFloat [B=2.0]
NODE n7: VariableSet [VarName=Value]
NODE n8: VariableGet [VarName=Value]
NODE n9: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n2.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n7.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Value [Float]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n9.Execute
DATA n8.Value -> n9.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HalveWhile
PARENT: Actor
VAR Value: Float = 1000.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Value]
NODE n3: WhileLoop
NODE n4: LessThan [B=1.0]
NODE n5: DivideFloat [B=2.0]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=Value]
NODE n7: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [<Bool>]
DATA n2.Value -> n4.A [<Float>]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n3.Condition [<Bool>]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n5.A [<Float>]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [<Float>]
EXEC n6.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n3.Condition [<Bool>]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n7.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n7.InString [<String>](stypy
raw_output:

PARENT: Actor
VAR Value: Float = 1000.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Value]
NODE n3: WhileLoop
NODE n4: LessThan [B=1.0]
NODE n5: DivideFloat [B=2.0]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=Value]
NODE n7: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [<Bool>]
DATA n2.Value -> n4.A [<Float>]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n3.Condition [<Bool>]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n5.A [<Float>]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [<Float>]
EXEC n6.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n3.Condition [<Bool>]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n7.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n7.InString [<String>](stypy

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay loops 10 times. Each iteration generates random X and Y within 1000 units and spawns an actor there.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RandomSpawner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: RandomFloat [Min=-1000, Max=1000]
NODE n4: RandomFloat [Min=-1000, Max=1000]
NODE n5: MakeVector [Z=0]
NODE n6: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Item]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n5.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Y [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.SpawnTransform [Transform]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Spawner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Count]

NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: LoopBody

NODE n7: MakeVector [Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n8: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=WBP_Target]
NODE n9: AddToPlayerScreen [Duration=2.0]
NODE n10: VariableSet [VarName=Count]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Int32]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.X [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Y [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.SpawnTransform [Transform]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Target [Widget]
EXEC n9.Completed -> n10.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n10.Value [Int32] {

EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n8.Execute

DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.B [Float]

DATA n8.Value -> n9.InString [String]

instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Targets. Loop through finding the closest one. Print the closest actor name.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FindClosest
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
VAR ClosestDist: Float = 999999.0
VAR ClosestActor: Actor = None
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: GetDistanceTo
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=ClosestDist]
NODE n6: LessThan
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: VariableSet [VarName=ClosestDist]
NODE n9: VariableSet [VarName=ClosestActor]
NODE n10: VariableGet [VarName=ClosestActor]
NODE n11: GetDisplayName
NODE n12: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n5.Value -> n6.B [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n8.Value [Float]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n9.Value [Actor]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n12.Execute
DATA n10.Value -> n11.Target [Actor]
DATA n11.ReturnValue -> n12.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FindClosestTarget
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: GetDistanceTo
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=MinDist]
NODE n6: LessEqualFloat
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: VariableGet [VarName=MinDist]
NODE n9: VariableSet [VarName=ClosestTarget]
NODE n10: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n8.Value -> n6.B [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n7.True -> n9.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n9.Value [Actor]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n10.Execute
DATA n9.Value -> n10.InString [String] }

DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n9.Value [Actor]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n10.Execute
DATA n9.Value -> n10.InString [String] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay uses Sequence. First output runs ForLoop 0-4 printing each. Second output prints Loop Done.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SequenceLoop
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Sequence
NODE n3: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=4]
NODE n4: PrintString
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Loop Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.Index -> n4.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Then_1 -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SequenceForLoop
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Sequence
NODE n3: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=4]
NODE n4: PrintString
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Loop Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.Index -> n4.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Then_1 -> n5.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SequenceForLoop
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Sequence
NODE n3: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=4]
NODE n4: PrintString
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Loop Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.Index -> n4.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Then_1 -> n5.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with string array Messages. On overlap use DoOnce then ForEachLoop to print all messages once.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_OneTimeMessages
PARENT: Actor
VAR Messages: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: DoOnce
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Messages]
NODE n4: ForEachLoop
NODE n5: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.Array [Array]
EXEC n4.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.ArrayElement -> n5.InString [String]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PrintMessagesOnce
PARENT: Actor
VAR Messages: Array<String>

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: DoOnce
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Messages]
NODE n4: ForEachLoop
NODE n5: PrintString

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute

DATA n3.Value -> n4.Array [Array] }

VAR Messages: Array<String>

NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: DoOnce
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Messages]
NODE n4: ForEachLoop
NODE n5: PrintString

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute

DATA n3.Value -> n4.Array [Array] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay runs ForLoop 0 to 9. Prints the index. After completion prints Total: 10 and destroys self.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CountAndDestroy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Total: 10"]
NODE n5: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CountToTen
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: ForLoop [FirstIndex=0, LastIndex=9]
NODE n3: PrintString
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Total: 10"]
NODE n5: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute }

GRAPH: EventGraph

EXEC n2.LoopBody -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Index -> n3.InString [String]
EXEC n2.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute }
